data.scheme_name: Stand-Up India Scheme  - Female  - All Categories  - New
data.benefits: The Stand Up India Scheme provides loans ranging from Rs. 10 lakhs to Rs. 100 lakhs for women entrepreneurs to set up greenfield enterprises.
data.eligibility:
Women entrepreneurs above 18 years of age are eligible.
Loans are available only for greenfield projects (first-time ventures).
data.conditions:
1. In non-individual enterprises, 51% ownership and control must be by women entrepreneurs. 
  2. Borrowers must not be in default to any bank or financial institution.
data.beneficiaries: All MSME units setting up a greenfield enterprise are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Women Entrepreneur Fresh Business (not floated by restructuring). 
  2. In all cases, the borrower shall be required to bring in minimum of 10% of the project cost as own contribution. 
  3. In case of non-individual enterprises atleast 51% of the shareholding should be held by Women entrepreneur.
data.nodal_agency: Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI)
data.context: The scheme enables SC/ST and Women borrowers to avail credit for the Greenfield project from Banks through the standup India portal.
data.objective: The objective of the Stand-Up India scheme is to facilitate bank loans to at least one Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) borrower and at least one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up a greenfield enterprise.
data.description:
• Scheme provides loan shall be a Composite Loan, i.e., to meet requirements of assets such as plant and machinery and working capital.
  • It is expected to cover 85% of project cost (providing loan from Rs. 10 lakhs up to Rs. 100 lakhs).
  • The rate of interest would be the lowest applicable rate of the bank for that category (rating), not to exceed (base rate (MCLR) + 3% + tenor premium).
  • Moratorium of up to 18 months.
  • Rupay card will be issued to enable the operation of the working capital component.
  • The stipulation of the loan being expected to cover 85% of the project cost would not apply if the borrower contribution along with convergence support from any other scheme exceeds 15% of the project cost.
data.how_to_apply: The scheme will be accessed in three potential ways: Directly at the branch or Through SIDBIs Stand-Up India portal (www.standupmitra.in) (http://www.standupmitra.in/) or Through the Lead District Manager (LDM).
data.funding_facilitator: SIDBI and All Scheduled Commercial Banks
data.funding_mechanism: Funds will be released by Bank as a loan (up to 85% of project cost).
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Caste Certificate 
2. MOM and AOA  
3. Partnership Deed 
4. Lease Deed/ Leave licence Agreement 
5. Passport sized photographs 
6. Identity proof 
7. Residence Proof 
8. Business Address proof 
9. Last three years' balance sheets of association 
10. Assets and liabilities statement of the promoters and guarantors 
11. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
12. Other KYC documents
data.checklist_info_d:
Address: Respective Bank Branch

Email id: Respective Bank Branch

Contact Details: Respective Bank Branch
data.beneficiary: All Industry  - All Entities  - All Locations  - All MSMEs
